p: Yeast two-hybrid assay showed that RYSV M can specifically interact with the CCP domains at the C-terminus (396-631 aa, CCP2) of NcHig, but not with other domains ( Figure 1B). However, both the N-terminal (1-131 aa) and C-terminal (132-262 aa) fragments of RYSV M did not interact with the CCP domains of NcHig ( Figure 1C). A GST pull-down assay confirmed that RYSV M-GST could bind to CCP2-His, whereas GST could not ( Figure 1D). Thus, NcHig CCP domains have the conserved role in recognizing RYSV M.
